solution_line_template: Four hats, each with three stripes, is {hats_3_stripes}*{stripes_per_hat_3}=<<{hats_3_stripes}*{stripes_per_hat_3}={total_stripes_3}>>{total_stripes_3} stripes.
Three hats with four stripes each is {hats_4_stripes}*{stripes_per_hat_4}=<<{hats_4_stripes}*{stripes_per_hat_4}={total_stripes_4}>>{total_stripes_4} stripes.
Six hats with no stripes is {hats_0_stripes}*{stripes_per_hat_0} = <<{hats_0_stripes}*{stripes_per_hat_0}={total_stripes_0}>>{total_stripes_0} stripes.
And two hats with 5 stripes each is {hats_5_stripes}*{stripes_per_hat_5}=<<{hats_5_stripes}*{stripes_per_hat_5}={total_stripes_5}>>{total_stripes_5} stripes.

The combined total number of stripes Vaishali has on all of her hats is {total_stripes_3}+{total_stripes_4}+{total_stripes_0}+{total_stripes_5}=<<{total_stripes_3}+{total_stripes_4}+{total_stripes_0}+{total_stripes_5}={combined_total}>>{combined_total} stripes.
